name: Beef and Vegetable Stir-fry
description: A quick and nutritious stir-fry featuring beef and colorful vegetables.
steps: 1. Slice the beef into thin strips (200g) and season with salt and pepper.
2. Peel and julienne the carrot (100g) and dice the tomato (100g).
3. Wash and cube the potato (150g).
4. Heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a large pan or wok over medium-high heat.
5. Add the beef and stir-fry for about 5 minutes until browned.
6. Add the potatoes and cook for an additional 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
7. Add the carrots and tomatoes, then stir-fry for another 3-4 minutes until vegetables are tender.
8. Drizzle with the remaining olive oil before serving.

name: Pasta with Tomato and Carrot Sauce
description: A hearty pasta dish with a savory sauce made from fresh tomatoes and carrots.
steps: 1. Cook pasta (200g) according to package instructions until al dente.
2. Dice the tomatoes (150g) and peel the carrot (100g) before grating it.
3. In a skillet, heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil over medium heat.
4. Add the grated carrot and sauté for about 3-4 minutes until soft.
5. Add diced tomatoes and bring to a simmer for about 5 minutes.
6. Mix the cooked pasta into the sauce, season with salt and pepper to taste.
7. Serve warm.

name: Fish Tacos with Pineapple Salsa
description: Fresh fish tacos topped with a zesty pineapple salsa.
steps: 1. Season the fish (200g) with salt, then grill or pan-fry over medium heat for about 5-7 minutes until cooked through.
2. Dice the pineapple (100g) and tomato (100g) into small pieces.
3. In a bowl, combine diced pineapple and tomato. Squeeze lime over the mixture if available and mix well.
4. Warm the tortillas (2 pieces) in a skillet for about 1-2 minutes until pliable.
5. Fill each tortilla with fish and top with pineapple salsa.
6. Serve immediately.

name: Sweet Potato and Egg Frittata
description: A healthy and filling frittata made with sweet potatoes and eggs.
steps: 1. Preheat your oven to 180°C (350°F).
2. Peel and cube the sweet potato (200g).
3. Heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in an oven-safe skillet over medium heat.
4. Add the sweet potato cubes, season with salt and pepper, and sauté for about 10 minutes until tender.
5. In a bowl, whisk together the eggs (4) and pour over the sweet potatoes in the skillet.
6. Cook on the stovetop for about 5 minutes, then transfer to the oven.
7. Bake for 15-20 minutes until the eggs are set.
8. Allow to cool slightly before slicing and serving.

name: Banana Oatmeal Pancakes
description: Fluffy pancakes made with ripe bananas and oats, perfect for breakfast.
steps: 1. Mash the bananas (2) in a bowl.
2. Add the egg (1), oats (100g), baking powder (1 tsp), and milk (100ml) to the bowl and mix well.
3. Heat a pan over medium heat and add a little olive oil.
4. Pour batter onto the pan (about 1/4 cup for each pancake) and cook for 2-3 minutes until bubbles form.
5. Flip the pancakes and cook for another 2-3 minutes until golden brown.
6. Serve with fresh fruit or syrup if desired.

name: Carrot and Tomato Soup
description: A comforting soup made with fresh carrots and tomatoes, great for lunch.
steps: 1. Peel and chop the carrots (200g) and tomatoes (200g).
2. In a pot, heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil over medium heat.
3. Add the carrots and sauté for about 5 minutes.
4. Add the tomatoes and cook for another 5 minutes.
5. Pour in 500ml of vegetable stock or water and bring to a boil.
6. Reduce heat and simmer for about 20 minutes until carrots are tender.
7. Use an immersion blender to puree the soup until smooth.
8. Season with salt and pepper to taste before serving.
